intro: Tubilium angustifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved tubilium, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae, which includes bellflowers, and is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
